                                                                                 java.lang.Boolean stateChangeEq,
                                                                                 @Query(value="state_change__neq")
                                                                                 java.lang.Boolean stateChangeNeq)
        List all device events. List all device events for an account.
        Parameters:
        limit - How many objects to retrieve in the page. The minimum limit is 2 and the maximum is 1000. Limit values outside of this range are set to the closest limit. (optional)
        order - The order of the records based on creation time, `ASC` or `DESC`; by default `ASC`. (optional)
        after - The ID of The item after which to retrieve the next page. (optional)
        include - Comma-separated list of data fields to return. Currently supported: `total_count` (optional)
        filter - URL encoded query string parameter to filter returned data. ##### Filtering ```?filter={URL encoded query string}``` The query string is made up of key/value pairs separated by ampersands. So for a query of ```key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3``` this would be encoded as follows: ```?filter=key1%3Dvalue1%26key2%3Dvalue2%26key3%3Dvalue3``` ###### Filterable fields: The below table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>date_time</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>description</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>device_id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>event_type</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>state_change</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The examples below show the queries in *unencoded* form. ###### By id: ```id={id}``` ###### By state change: ```state_change=[True|False]``` ###### By event type: ```event_type={value}``` ###### On date-time fields: Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format ```YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ```. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12Z * UTC RFC3339 shortened - without milliseconds and punctuation e.g. 20161130T162512Z Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality * greater than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__gte``` * less than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__lte``` Lower and upper limits to a date-time range may be specified by including both the ```__gte``` and ```__lte``` forms in the filter. ```{field name}[|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}``` ##### Multi-field example ```id=0158d38771f70000000000010010038c&state_change=True&date_time__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z``` Encoded: ```?filter=id%3D0158d38771f70000000000010010038c%26state_change%3DTrue%26date_time__gte%3D2016-11-30T16%3A25%3A12.1234Z``` ##### Filtering with filter operators String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `event_type__in=update.device.device-created,update.device.device-updated` (optional)
        dateTimeIn - in filter for the date_time field (optional)
        dateTimeNin - nin filter for the date_time field (optional)
        dateTimeLte - lte filter for the date_time field (optional)
        dateTimeGte - gte filter for the date_time field (optional)
        descriptionEq - eq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNeq - neq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionIn - in filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNin - nin filter for the description field (optional)
        idEq - eq filter for the id field (optional)
        idNeq - neq filter for the id field (optional)
        idIn - in filter for the id field (optional)
        idNin - nin filter for the id field (optional)
        deviceIdEq - eq filter for the device_id field (optional)
        deviceIdNeq - neq filter for the device_id field (optional)
        deviceIdIn - in filter for the device_id field (optional)
        deviceIdNin - nin filter for the device_id field (optional)
        eventTypeEq - eq filter for the event_type field (optional)
        eventTypeNeq - neq filter for the event_type field (optional)
        eventTypeIn - in filter for the event_type field (optional)
        eventTypeNin - nin filter for the event_type field (optional)
        stateChangeEq - eq filter for the state_change field (optional)
        stateChangeNeq - neq filter for the state_change field (optional)
        Returns:
        Call<DeviceEventPage>

fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format ```YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ```. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12Z * UTC RFC3339 shortened - without milliseconds and punctuation e.g. 20161130T162512Z Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality * greater than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__gte``` * less than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__lte``` Lower and upper limits to a date-time range may be specified by including both the ```__gte``` and ```__lte``` forms in the filter. ```{field name}[|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}``` ###### On device custom attributes: ```custom_attributes__{param}={value}``` ```custom_attributes__tag=TAG1``` ##### Multi-field example ```state=bootstrapped&created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z``` Encoded: ```?filter=state%3Dbootstrapped%26created_at__gte%3D2016-11-30T16%3A25%3A12.1234Z%26created_at__lte%3D2016-11-30T00%3A00%3A00Z``` ##### Filtering with filter operators String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `state__nin=unenrolled,dergistered` (optional)

                                                                           @Query(value="date_time__lte")
                                                                           org.joda.time.DateTime dateTimeLte,
                                                                           @Query(value="date_time__gte")
                                                                           org.joda.time.DateTime dateTimeGte,
                                                                           @Query(value="description__eq")
                                                                           java.lang.String descriptionEq,
                                                                           @Query(value="description__neq")

                                                                           @Query(value="id__neq")
                                                                           java.lang.String idNeq,
                                                                           @Query(value="id__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String idIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="id__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String idNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="device_id__eq")
                                                                           java.lang.String deviceIdEq,
                                                                           @Query(value="device_id__neq")
                                                                           java.lang.String deviceIdNeq,
                                                                           @Query(value="device_id__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String deviceIdIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="device_id__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String deviceIdNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="event_type__eq")
                                                                           java.lang.String eventTypeEq,
                                                                           @Query(value="event_type__neq")
                                                                           java.lang.String eventTypeNeq,
                                                                           @Query(value="event_type__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String eventTypeIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="event_type__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String eventTypeNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="state_change__eq")
                                                                           java.lang.Boolean stateChangeEq,
                                                                           @Query(value="state_change__neq")
                                                                           java.lang.Boolean stateChangeNeq,
                                                                           @Query(value="state_change__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String stateChangeIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="state_change__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String stateChangeNin)
        DEPRECATED: List all device events. DEPRECATED: List all device events. Use `/v3/device-events/` instead.
        Parameters:
        limit - How many objects to retrieve in the page. The minimum limit is 2 and the maximum is 1000. Limit values outside of this range are set to the closest limit. (optional)
        order - The order of the records based on creation time, `ASC` or `DESC`; by default `ASC`. (optional)
        after - The ID of The item after which to retrieve the next page. (optional)
        include - Comma-separated list of data fields to return. Currently supported: `total_count`. (optional)
        filter - URL encoded query string parameter to filter returned data. ##### Filtering ```?filter={URL encoded query string}``` The query string is made up of key/value pairs separated by ampersands. So for a query of ```key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3``` this would be encoded as follows: ```?filter=key1%3Dvalue1%26key2%3Dvalue2%26key3%3Dvalue3``` ###### Filterable fields: The below table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>date_time</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>description</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>device_id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>event_type</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>state_change</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The examples below show the queries in *unencoded* form. ###### By id: ```id={id}``` ###### By state change: ```state_change=[True|False]``` ###### By event type: ```event_type={value}``` ###### On date-time fields: Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format ```YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ```. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12Z * UTC RFC3339 shortened - without milliseconds and punctuation e.g. 20161130T162512Z Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality * greater than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__gte``` * less than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__lte``` Lower and upper limits to a date-time range may be specified by including both the ```__gte``` and ```__lte``` forms in the filter. ```{field name}[|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}``` ##### Multi-field example ```id=0158d38771f70000000000010010038c&state_change=True&date_time__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z``` Encoded: ```?filter=id%3D0158d38771f70000000000010010038c%26state_change%3DTrue%26date_time__gte%3D2016-11-30T16%3A25%3A12.1234Z``` ##### Filtering with filter operators String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `event_type__in=update.device.device-created,update.device.device-updated` (optional)
        dateTimeIn - in filter for the date_time field (optional)
        dateTimeNin - nin filter for the date_time field (optional)
        dateTimeLte - lte filter for the date_time field (optional)
        dateTimeGte - gte filter for the date_time field (optional)
        descriptionEq - eq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNeq - neq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionIn - in filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNin - nin filter for the description field (optional)
        idEq - eq filter for the id field (optional)
        idNeq - neq filter for the id field (optional)
        idIn - in filter for the id field (optional)
        idNin - nin filter for the id field (optional)
        deviceIdEq - eq filter for the device_id field (optional)
        deviceIdNeq - neq filter for the device_id field (optional)
        deviceIdIn - in filter for the device_id field (optional)
        deviceIdNin - nin filter for the device_id field (optional)
        eventTypeEq - eq filter for the event_type field (optional)
        eventTypeNeq - neq filter for the event_type field (optional)
        eventTypeIn - in filter for the event_type field (optional)
        eventTypeNin - nin filter for the event_type field (optional)
        stateChangeEq - eq filter for the state_change field (optional)
        stateChangeNeq - neq filter for the state_change field (optional)
        stateChangeIn - in filter for the state_change field (optional)
        stateChangeNin - nin filter for the state_change field (optional)

        Call<DeviceEventPage>

So for a query of ```key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3``` this would be encoded as follows: ```?filter=key1%3Dvalue1%26key2%3Dvalue2%26key3%3Dvalue3``` The below table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>created_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>etag</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>name</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>query</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>updated_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The examples below show the queries in *unencoded* form. ###### By device query properties (all properties are filterable): For example: ```description={value}``` ###### On date-time fields: Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format ```YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ```.                                                                                        java.lang.String datafileChecksumIn,
                                                                                       @Query(value="datafile_checksum__nin")
                                                                                       java.lang.String datafileChecksumNin,
                                                                                       @Query(value="datafile_size__eq")
                                                                                       java.lang.Long datafileSizeEq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="datafile_size__neq")
                                                                                       java.lang.Long datafileSizeNeq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="datafile_size__in")
                                                                                       java.lang.String datafileSizeIn,
                                                                                       @Query(value="datafile_size__nin")
                                                                                       java.lang.String datafileSizeNin,
                                                                                       @Query(value="description__eq")
                                                                                       java.lang.String descriptionEq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="description__neq")
                                                                                       java.lang.String descriptionNeq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="description__in")
                                                                                       java.lang.String descriptionIn,
                                                                                       @Query(value="description__nin")
                                                                                       java.lang.String descriptionNin,
                                                                                       @Query(value="id__eq")
                                                                                       java.lang.String idEq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="id__neq")
                                                                                       java.lang.String idNeq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="id__in")
                                                                                       java.lang.String idIn,
                                                                                       @Query(value="id__nin")
                                                                                       java.lang.String idNin,
                                                                                       @Query(value="name__eq")
                                                                                       java.lang.String nameEq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="name__neq")
                                                                                       java.lang.String nameNeq,
                                                                                       @Query(value="name__in")
                                                                                       java.lang.String nameIn,
                                                                                       @Query(value="name__nin")
                                                                                       java.lang.String nameNin,
                                                                                       @Query(value="updated_at__in")
                                                                                       java.lang.String updatedAtIn,
                                                                                       @Query(value="updated_at__nin")
                                                                                       java.lang.String updatedAtNin,
                                                                                       @Query(value="updated_at__lte")
                                                                                       org.joda.time.DateTime updatedAtLte,
                                                                                       @Query(value="updated_at__gte")
                                                                                       org.joda.time.DateTime updatedAtGte)
        List all images List all firmware images.
        Parameters:
        limit - How many objects to retrieve in the page. The minimum limit is 2 and the maximum is 1000. Limit values outside of this range are set to the closest limit. (optional)
        order - ASC or DESC (optional)
        after - The ID of the the item after which to retrieve the next page (optional)
        include - A comma-separated list of data fields to return. Currently supported: total_count (optional)
        filter - URL-encoded query string parameter to filter returned data `?filter={URL-encoded query string}` ###### Filterable fields: The table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>created_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>datafile</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>datafile_checksum</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>datafile_size</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>description</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>etag</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>name</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>updated_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The query string is made up of key-value pairs separated by ampersands. For example, this query: `key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3` would be URL-encoded as: `?filter=key1__eq%3Dvalue1%26key2__eq%3Dvalue2%26key3__eq%3Dvalue3` **Filtering by properties** `name__eq=myimage` **Filtering on date-time fields** Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format, `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ`. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds. Example: `2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z` * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds. Example: `2016-11-30T16:25:12Z` * UTC RFC3339 shortened without milliseconds and punctuation. Example: `20161130T162512Z` Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality by appending `__eq` to the field name * greater than or equal to by appending `__gte` to the field name * less than or equal to by appending `__lte` to the field name `{field name}[|__eq|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}` Time ranges may be specified by including both the `__gte` and `__lte` forms in the filter. For example: `created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z` **Filtering on multiple fields** `name__eq=myimage&created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z` **Filtering with filter operators** String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `name__in=fw-image1,fw-image2` (optional)
        createdAtIn - in filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtNin - nin filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtLte - lte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtGte - gte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        datafileEq - eq filter for the datafile field (optional)
        datafileNeq - neq filter for the datafile field (optional)
        datafileIn - in filter for the datafile field (optional)
        datafileNin - nin filter for the datafile field (optional)
        datafileChecksumEq - eq filter for the datafile_checksum field (optional)
        datafileChecksumNeq - neq filter for the datafile_checksum field (optional)
        datafileChecksumIn - in filter for the datafile_checksum field (optional)
        datafileChecksumNin - nin filter for the datafile_checksum field (optional)
        datafileSizeEq - eq filter for the datafile_size field (optional)
        datafileSizeNeq - neq filter for the datafile_size field (optional)
        datafileSizeIn - in filter for the datafile_size field (optional)
        datafileSizeNin - nin filter for the datafile_size field (optional)
        descriptionEq - eq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNeq - neq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionIn - in filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNin - nin filter for the description field (optional)
        idEq - eq filter for the id field (optional)
        idNeq - neq filter for the id field (optional)
        idIn - in filter for the id field (optional)
        idNin - nin filter for the id field (optional)
        nameEq - eq filter for the name field (optional)
        nameNeq - neq filter for the name field (optional)
        nameIn - in filter for the name field (optional)
        nameNin - nin filter for the name field (optional)
        updatedAtIn - in filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtNin - nin filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtLte - lte filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtGte - gte filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        Returns:
        Call<FirmwareImagePage>

        Get raw billing data of the active devices for the month. Fetch raw billing data for active devices for the currently authenticated commercial non-subtenant account. This is supplementary data for the billing report. The raw billing data of the active devices for subtenant accounts are included in their aggregator's raw billing data of the active devices. The endpoint returns the URL to download the gzipped CSV file. The first line is the header providing information on active devices, for example, the ID of an active device. **Example:** ``` curl -X GET https://api.us-east-1.mbedcloud.com/v3/billing-report-active-devices?month=2018-07 \\ -H 'Authorization: Bearer <api_key>' ```

                                                                           @Query(value="devices_count__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String devicesCountIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="devices_count__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String devicesCountNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="devices_count__lte")
                                                                           java.lang.Integer devicesCountLte,
                                                                           @Query(value="devices_count__gte")
                                                                           java.lang.Integer devicesCountGte,
                                                                           @Query(value="name__eq")
                                                                           java.lang.String nameEq,
                                                                           @Query(value="name__neq")
                                                                           java.lang.String nameNeq,
                                                                           @Query(value="name__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String nameIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="name__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String nameNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="custom_attributes__eq")
                                                                           java.lang.String customAttributesEq,
                                                                           @Query(value="custom_attributes__neq")
                                                                           java.lang.String customAttributesNeq,
                                                                           @Query(value="created_at__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String createdAtIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="created_at__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String createdAtNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="created_at__lte")
                                                                           org.joda.time.DateTime createdAtLte,
                                                                           @Query(value="created_at__gte")
                                                                           org.joda.time.DateTime createdAtGte,
                                                                           @Query(value="updated_at__in")
                                                                           java.lang.String updatedAtIn,
                                                                           @Query(value="updated_at__nin")
                                                                           java.lang.String updatedAtNin,
                                                                           @Query(value="updated_at__lte")
                                                                           org.joda.time.DateTime updatedAtLte,
                                                                           @Query(value="updated_at__gte")
                                                                           org.joda.time.DateTime updatedAtGte)
        List all groups. List all groups.
        Parameters:
        limit - How many objects to retrieve in the page. The minimum limit is 2 and the maximum is 1000. Limit values outside of this range are set to the closest limit. (optional)
        order - The order of the records based on creation time, `ASC` or `DESC`; by default `ASC`. (optional)
        after - The ID of The item after which to retrieve the next page. (optional)
        include - Comma-separated list of data fields to return. Currently supported: `total_count`. (optional)
        filter - URL encoded query string parameter to filter returned data. ##### Filtering ```?filter={URL encoded query string}``` The query string is made up of key/value pairs separated by ampersands. So for a query of ```key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3``` this would be encoded as follows: ```?filter=key1%3Dvalue1%26key2%3Dvalue2%26key3%3Dvalue3``` ###### Filterable fields: The table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>devices_count</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>name</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>custom_attributes</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>created_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>updated_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>etag</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The examples below show the queries in *unencoded* form. ###### By device group properties: ```name__eq=mygroup``` ###### On date-time fields: Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format ```YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ```. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds e.g. 2016-11-30T16:25:12Z * UTC RFC3339 shortened - without milliseconds and punctuation e.g. 20161130T162512Z Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality * greater than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__gte``` * less than or equal to &ndash; field name suffixed with ```__lte``` Lower and upper limits to a date-time range may be specified by including both the ```__gte``` and ```__lte``` forms in the filter. ```{field name}[|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}``` ###### By device group custom attributes: ```custom_attributes__{param}={value}``` ```custom_attributes__tag=TAG1``` ##### Multi-field example ```name__eq=mygroup&created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z``` Encoded: ```?filter=name__eq%3Dmygroup%26created_at__gte%3D2016-11-30T16%3A25%3A12.1234Z%26created_at__lte%3D2016-12-30T00%3A00%3A00Z``` ##### Filtering with filter operators String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `name__in=group1,group2` (optional)
        idEq - eq filter for the id field (optional)
        idNeq - neq filter for the id field (optional)
        idIn - in filter for the id field (optional)
        idNin - nin filter for the id field (optional)
        devicesCountEq - eq filter for the devices_count field (optional)
        devicesCountNeq - neq filter for the devices_count field (optional)
        devicesCountIn - in filter for the devices_count field (optional)
        devicesCountNin - nin filter for the devices_count field (optional)
        devicesCountLte - lte filter for the devices_count field (optional)
        devicesCountGte - gte filter for the devices_count field (optional)
        nameEq - eq filter for the name field (optional)
        nameNeq - neq filter for the name field (optional)
        nameIn - in filter for the name field (optional)
        nameNin - nin filter for the name field (optional)
        customAttributesEq - eq filter for the custom_attributes field (optional)
        customAttributesNeq - neq filter for the custom_attributes field (optional)
        createdAtIn - in filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtNin - nin filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtLte - lte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtGte - gte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        updatedAtIn - in filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtNin - nin filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtLte - lte filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtGte - gte filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        Returns:
        Call<DeviceGroupPage>

        after - The ID of the the item after which to retrieve the next page (optional)
        include - A comma-separated list of data fields to return. Currently supported: total_count (optional)
        filter - URL-encoded query string parameter to filter returned data `?filter={URL-encoded query string}` ###### Filterable fields: The below table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>created_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>description</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>device_filter</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>etag</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>finished</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>name</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>root_manifest_id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>started_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>state</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>updated_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>when</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The query string is made up of key-value pairs separated by ampersands. For example, this query: `key1__eq=value1&key2__eq=value2&key3__eq=value3` would be URL-encoded as: `?filter=key1__eq%3Dvalue1%26key2__eq%3Dvalue2%26key3__eq%3Dvalue3` **Filtering by campaign properties** `state__eq=[draft|scheduled|devicefectch|devicecopy|publishing|deploying|deployed|manifestremoved|expired]` `root_manifest_id__eq=43217771234242e594ddb433816c498a` **Filtering on date-time fields** Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format, `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ`. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds. Example: `2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z` * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds. Example: `2016-11-30T16:25:12Z` * UTC RFC3339 shortened without milliseconds and punctuation. Example: `20161130T162512Z` Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality by appending `__eq` to the field name * greater than or equal to by appending `__gte` to the field name * less than or equal to by appending `__lte` to the field name `{field name}[|__eq|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}` Time ranges may be specified by including both the `__gte` and `__lte` forms in the filter. For example: `created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z` **Filtering on multiple fields** `state__eq=deployed&created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z` **Filtering with filter operators** String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `name__in=fw-image1,fw-image2` (optional)
        createdAtIn - in filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtNin - nin filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtLte - lte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtGte - gte filter for the created_at field (optional)

        after - The ID of the the item after which to retrieve the next page (optional)
        include - A comma-separated list of data fields to return. Currently supported: total_count (optional)
        filter - URL-encoded query string parameter to filter returned data `?filter={URL-encoded query string}` ###### Filterable fields: The table lists all the fields that can be filtered on with certain filters: <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Field</th> <th>= / __eq / __neq</th> <th>__in / __nin</th> <th>__lte / __gte</th> <tr> <thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>name</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>description</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>complete</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>firmware_image_id</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>status</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>&nbsp;</td> </tr> <tr> <td>created_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>etag</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> <tr> <td>updated_at</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> <td>✓</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> &nbsp; The query string is made up of key-value pairs separated by ampersands. For example, this query: `key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3` would be URL-encoded as: `?filter=key1__eq%3Dvalue1%26key2__eq%3Dvalue2%26key3__eq%3Dvalue3` **Filtering by properties** `name__eq=myimage` **Filtering on date-time fields** Date-time fields should be specified in UTC RFC3339 format, `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.msZ`. There are three permitted variations: * UTC RFC3339 with milliseconds. Example: `2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z` * UTC RFC3339 without milliseconds. Example: `2016-11-30T16:25:12Z` * UTC RFC3339 shortened without milliseconds and punctuation. Example: `20161130T162512Z` Date-time filtering supports three operators: * equality by appending `__eq` to the field name * greater than or equal to by appending `__gte` to the field name * less than or equal to by appending `__lte` to the field name `{field name}[|__eq|__lte|__gte]={UTC RFC3339 date-time}` Time ranges may be specified by including both the `__gte` and `__lte` forms in the filter. For example: `created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z` **Filtering on multiple fields** `name__eq=myimage&created_at__gte=2016-11-30T16:25:12.1234Z&created_at__lte=2016-12-30T00:00:00Z` **Filtering with filter operators** String field filtering supports the following operators: * equality: `__eq` * non-equality: `__neq` * in : `__in` * not in: `__nin` For `__in` and `__nin` filters list of parameters must be comma-separated: `name__in=fw-image1,fw-image2` (optional)
        updatedAtIn - in filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtNin - nin filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtLte - lte filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        updatedAtGte - gte filter for the updated_at field (optional)
        nameEq - eq filter for the name field (optional)
        nameNeq - neq filter for the name field (optional)
        nameIn - in filter for the name field (optional)
        nameNin - nin filter for the name field (optional)
        createdAtIn - in filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtNin - nin filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtLte - lte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        createdAtGte - gte filter for the created_at field (optional)
        descriptionEq - eq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNeq - neq filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionIn - in filter for the description field (optional)
        descriptionNin - nin filter for the description field (optional)
        idEq - eq filter for the id field (optional)
        idNeq - neq filter for the id field (optional)
        idIn - in filter for the id field (optional)
        idNin - nin filter for the id field (optional)
        completeEq - eq filter for the complete field (optional)
        completeNeq - neq filter for the complete field (optional)
        statusEq - eq filter for the status field (optional)
        statusNeq - neq filter for the status field (optional)
        statusIn - in filter for the status field (optional)
        statusNin - nin filter for the status field (optional)
